main.name: Ashish Shrestha
main.description: I am a software engineer proficient in Database Systems and Full-Stack Development
main.bio: I am a passionate and motivated software engineer looking to be more involved in the technology industry. I recently graduated from UC Berkeley with a degree in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, and am starting my career at AWS as a Software Development Engineer for the Redshift team. In addition to programming, I love to game, browse Reddit, and play and watch basketball.

resume.skillmessage: Below, I have listed the programming languages that I am most comfortable with

education.degree: B.S Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
education.coursework: At Cal, I took many of the CS and EE courses offered such as the basic data structures and algorithms, as well as other upper division courses like operating systems. Relevant coursework includes, but is not limited to the following: AI, Computer Security, Database Systems, Algorithms, Computer Graphics.
education.extracurriculars: For extracurriculars, I was a Learning Assistant for the Intro to Data Science course. As a Learning Assistant, I lead lab setions and tutored students in areas of the  course they struggled with. In addition, I was a consultant as a part of Product Development at Berkeley where I developed mobile applications in React Native and Flutter for startups.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: As a part of the Redshift team, I developed software to improve the ease of use for Redshift customers. Specifically, I extended Automatic Table Optimization to tables created through the CTAS command in SQL to optimize the cost and performance.

work.title: Undergraduate Researcher
work.description: In the Guaiya Means Love project, I transitioned the codebase from Python to JavaScript to increase the accessibility of the project across all platforms. In addition, I added new features to increase user interaction and cohesion of the program.
